title: Strengthening E-Learning Practical Competencies: Web Development for Early Childhood Reading Habit Formation Using Design Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Web Development and Understanding of Design Thinking Processes, Foundational Knowledge of Early Childhood Development Stages
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners acquire the ability to design web solutions for early childhood reading habit formation by applying the 5-stage design thinking process (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test)
Learners develop competency in conducting surveys and interview techniques to analyze user (family manager/teacher/librarian) needs

Over six months, learners will conduct at least three usability tests on a web-based reading education tool prototype, derive at least five improvement suggestions based on test results, implement at least three of these, and improve usability evaluation scores (5-point scale) by at least 3.5 points
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
